tiles.name: Jagged Peak
tiles.description: A towering mountain peak, covered in snow and ice. Difficult to traverse. Part of the 'Mountain peaks' landmark and reflects the 'Alpine/Arctic' climate.

tiles.name: Western Cliff
tiles.description: A sheer cliff face, part of the natural 'Cliff face' landmark, with sparse vegetation and steep slopes as specified in 'terrain_types'. Scale aligns with 'scale_chunk_description'.

tiles.name: Western Ascent
tiles.description: A winding rocky path leading up the mountain. Narrow, as indicated in 'features', and made of 'Rock' terrain. Connects lower elevations to the village.

tiles.name: Lower Dwellings
tiles.description: A cluster of stone dwellings built into the cliff face, representing a part of 'Stone dwellings' landmark and village structure. Shows modern elements within the 'Modern with traditional elements (Sherpa culture)' era.

tiles.name: The Crossing
tiles.description: A precarious rope bridge spanning a deep chasm, a key 'Rope bridge' landmark and perilous feature as described in 'features', contributing to the 'dangerous' tone.

tiles.name: Prayer Flag Plaza
tiles.description: The heart of the mountain village, adorned with colorful 'Prayer flags'. Represents the 'mystical' atmosphere and blends with Sherpa Culture.

tiles.name: Southern Crevice
tiles.description: The edge of a deep chasm, implying the 'Deep chasm' landmark and inherent danger. Influences the isolated tone. Includes traces of 'glacial runoff' from the 'water_presence' specification.

tiles.name: Yak Trail
tiles.description: A steep, snow-covered slope, potentially used by 'Yaks/other mountain animals'. Shows a mix of 'Snow' and 'Steep slopes' terrain types.

tiles.name: Eastern Glade
tiles.description: A treeless area prone to avalanches, implying the 'Avalanche zones' feature. Reflects the 'dangerous' atmosphere and risk present.
